intro: Astragalus alopecuroides f. pallasianus, commonly known as Pallas's milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish-pink flowers clustered in racemes. The plant has palmately divided leaves with 5–7 leaflets, and its root system is fibrous and adapted to rocky soils. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in steppes and alpine meadows. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in nitrogen fixation and its use in traditional medicine.
